memberdef.name: m_edge_preferred
m_RF_preferred

briefdescription.para: Use this method to load timeshifts from a .dT file.
Set maximum hits to be read in a file.
Set the multiplicity gate for the events used for coincidence timeshift calculation.

detaileddescription.para:
Mandatory only if calculate timeshifts
min_mult and max_mult included.

briefdescription.para: Use setName instead. Set output file name of the timeshifts data.

detaileddescription.para:
Mandatory only if calculate timeshifts
If not set, it is automatically named after the root file.

briefdescription.para: Set the output directory (full path);.
Set output file name of the timeshifts data and root file.
Use setName instead. Set output root file containing the raw and corrected time spectra.
Use this method to setup the parameters from a string in order to calculate the timeshifts.
Set RF offset (synonymous to Timeshifts::setRFShift)

simplesect.para: Use only if calculating timeshifts with RF

briefdescription.para: Set RF offset (synonymous to Timeshifts::setRFShift)

simplesect.para: Use only if calculating timeshifts with RF

briefdescription.para: Set RF shift (synonymous to Timeshifts::setRFOffset)

simplesect.para: Use only if calculating timeshifts with RF

briefdescription.para: Set the time reference label.
Set the time reference.

detaileddescription.para:
Mandatory only if calculate timeshifts
Either the full name, or the label number

briefdescription.para: Set the time window in ns.

simplesect.para: It is better to keep it at its default value, otherwise you can miss some detectors

briefdescription.para: Setup the time window for the coincidence in ns.
Call the Timeshifts::load() method to load the timeshifts from a .dT file.
Call the Timeshifts::load() method to load the timeshifts from a .dT file.
For faster to root conversion only : Timeshifts::load() loads the timeshifts from a .dT file.

detaileddescription.para:
path
The path of the out root directory (/path/to/run_name)
name
The name of the .dT file without the extension (e.g. run_10)
Will read a file in /path/Timeshitfs/name.dT

briefdescription.para: Copy constructor.
Set verbosity level.

detaileddescription.para:
Mandatory only if calculate timeshifts
It will print the fit parameters in the terminal

briefdescription.para: Used to create.
To verify an already calculated timeshift .dT data file.
To write down the histograms and the data.

parameterdescription.para: Will automatically create the following name as output : (name+".dT") and (name+"_dT.root")

briefdescription.para: To write down the data.

parameterdescription.para: Name of the output data file : (name+".dT")

briefdescription.para: To write down the histograms.

parameterdescription.para: Name of the output data file : (name+"_dT.root")

briefdescription.para: Calculates the time difference between all detectors and a reference detector.

listitem.para: The timestamps and timeshifts are in picoseconds Goal 1 : calculate the time shifts between detectors How : Use one detector as reference, preferencially with good time resolution Create coincidences using the CoincBuilder event builder Calculate the difference in timestamp as follow : ref_time - detector_time Finally, output the (.dT) file containing the time shifts of all the detectors Also produces a .root file containing the raw and corrected time spectra. This module includes multithreading management using MTObject::parallelise_function(function, parameters...) Goal 2 : read a timeshift file (.dT) previously calculated by this module Goal 3 : apply the timeshifts by calling the operator[] : time_correct = time_shifted + timeshifts[label]; Example at the end
